data.title: Orchestra After 5: Haydn and Mozart Power Hour

data.text:
András Schiff Conductor and Piano

Tristan Rais-Sherman Host

Haydn Piano Concerto in D major

Mozart Piano Concerto No. 27

Program Notes

Experience two brilliant piano concertos by Haydn and Mozart in a bite-sized Orchestra After 5 concert perfect for your Thursday evening! In the hands of The Philadelphia Orchestra and star pianist András Schiff, these legendary composers have never sounded so good.

Enjoy a signature cocktail and pre-concert fun in the plaza with a DJ set, painting experience, and scavenger hunt. Hang out after the concert for a talkback about the performance you just heard.

5 PM Pre-concert fun!

Musical Genre Jumping (from Classical to Pop, Pop to Classical) featuring a curated DJ set by Omar Saleem of Mobbluz with cultural liner notes by Philadelphia Orchestra Principal Librarian Nicole Jordan

“Moz-Art: A Symphony of Colors” painting activity by Artrageous Brush and Flow

“Haydn Seek” Scavenger Hunt

Specialty cocktails available for purchase

6:30 PM 60-minute Philadelphia Orchestra concert

7:30 PM Post-concert talkback

Key into classics, key into a new way to experience them with us.

Orchestra After 5: Classical Concerts Done Differently

The new Orchestra After 5 concert series offers brilliant, bite-sized concerts after your workday. The evening also features engaging pre-concert activities, themed cocktails, and casual conversations with our own GRAMMY-winning musicians. Classical concerts with a casual vibe—a new Thursday tradition.
